intro: Jacea abbreviata, commonly known as the short-stemmed jacea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster. Jacea abbreviata is valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
